data.benefits: The Government has launched various programs and facilities in order to provide a safe and fast-paced environment for Startups in Rajasthan.
data.eligibility:
Eligibility Criteria for Startups:
Should not exceed 10 years of existence from the date of incorporation.
Must comply with DPIIT norm
Annual turnover must not exceed Rs. 100 crore in any financial year since incorporation.
Must not be formed by splitting or reconstructing an existing business.
Must be registered in Rajasthan or have a branch/sales office in the state.
data.conditions: All Startup can get it based on their requiremnt
data.beneficiaries:
Eligibility Criteria for Startups:

data.prerequisites: Based on their QRate and development period various Scheme can be availed.
data.nodal_agency: Department Of Information Technology and Communication
data.context:
• The policy was officially launched by Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot at the second edition of the Rajasthan DigiFest 2022 in Jodhpur, as part of the Department of Information Technology and Communication’s three-day youth and entrepreneurship summit from November 11-13, 2022. 
  • To establish Rajasthan as India’s leading entrepreneurship and innovation centre by providing a conducive environment to foster a thriving and diverse startup ecosystem delivering sustainable economic and societal outcomes for the State and people of Rajasthan.Rajasthan with its history in entrepreneurship, intellectual and human capital, is on the path to emerge as a center of innovation and business activity. 
  • The State is striving to build a conducive ecosystem for startups to promote innovation, create new products and services, generate employment, and thus strengthen the regional and national economy To further ignite the spirit of entrepreneurship in the State and convert ideas into businesses, the State Government had launched iStart, the flagship startup program which has enabled growth for over 2000 associated startups. It is one of the most recognised state-run startup ecosystems in the country.
data.objective:
To establish Rajasthan as India’s leading entrepreneurship and innovation centre by providing a conducive environment to foster a thriving and diverse startup ecosystem 
delivering sustainable economic and societal outcomes for the State and people of Rajasthan.
data.description:
The Government has launched various programs and facilities in order to provide a safe and fast-paced environment for Startups in Rajasthan. 

1. Outreach and Awareness: To increase awareness and support marketing of Rajasthan based startups, the Government will provide the following assistance: Exposure Visits , Networking Events, Corporate Partnerships and funding support, Sector Specific Events and many more. 

2. Capacity and Skill development: To increase skills amongst the Rajasthan Startup so that they can smoothly run the startup through such benefits: Talent Marketplace, Mentoring Support, Ambassador Program, iStart Internship Program, Rajiv Gandhi Knowledge Service and Innovation Hub, Centralized Incubator Model, Training and Upskilling Centers, Start Spotlight. 

3. Ease of Doing Business: To facilitate smooth operations for startups, the Government has announced following Ease of Doing Business measures: Patent Information Centre (‘PIC’), Plug and Play Incubation Facilities, Self-Certification. 

4. Public Procurement: Procurement orders will be given to Startups by government on their site base on their Qrate : Special Procurement Related Provisions, Additional Procurement Orders.
data.how_to_apply: Businesses have to register to iStart portal on Gov of Rajasthan.
data.funding_facilitator: Department of information Technology and communication
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get incentive after the approval of the application by the concerned authority.
data.highlights:
1. The Marwadi International Federation (MIF), a non-profit organisation, has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with an incubation hub of the University of Rajasthan to help state's youth enter the startup sector. 
  2. Rajasthan to invest Rs 10,000 crore for 20,000 new MSMEs and 1 lakh jobs: RFC’s Balwant Singh Ligree.
data.additional_info:
• Exposure Visits :The Government will organise at least one national and one international exposure visit per year for startup members and students aspiring to start their own ventures. The eligibility and provisions for the program will be notified by the government from time to time. 
  • Networking Events :To utilise and grow the startup ecosystem of the state, the Government will facilitate networking through events such as hackathons, ideathons, startup exhibitions, investor pitches, demo days, expert talks, and startup meets. Corporate Partnerships and funding support :Periodic corporate meetups will be organized wherein select startups will get an opportunity to network with partnered corporates through: 

a) On-boarding corporate experts from various fields on iStart program.

b) Facilitating corporate tie-ups. 

c) Channelizing the funding available with corporates towards developing and promoting the startup ecosystem in the State Sector specific events: To facilitate startups focused on specific sectors the government will sponsor or host sector focused events according to the Event Sponsorship Framework as the program will support three broad categories of events in order to support Startup ecosystem : Industry Entrepreneur led events, Academic Institution (All IITs, IIMs, NIT's).

  • Government Departments, Festivals(International, National, and State festivals such as Jaipur Literature Festival and similar festivals). Financial Support : The financial support shall be up to a maximum of Rs. 35 lakh (exclusive of applicable taxes), as decided at the level of nodal department . The financial support shall be evaluated on a case-to-case basis depending on the deliverables being extended by the organizer.
data.checklist_info_a:
Incorporation Certificate(MCA,DPIIT)
GSTIN Number
PAN card
Aadhar Card
Rajasthan Udhyog Doocument
Partnership deed or Self Declaration
